page.title: 13BENINGTON SCHOOL (4)
page.content: The addition of a large meadow for the use of the school at the back of the building, provides open space for the children to play freely, but the origi- nal cramped tarmacadam playground can still be seen at the front. Most of the village children attend Benington School, but a few choose to attend neighbouring schools such as those at Stevenage. The day starts at 9.00 a.m. and finish- es at 3.30 p.m. In the morning there is a 15 min. playtime and lunchtime is from 12.00 noon to 1.0 p.m. The present School Role is 80. Of these 50 are Juniors and 30 are Infants.
